meanings.definition: The state or quality of being shaky or trembling.
meanings.sent1: The quakinesses of the old bridge made me nervous.
meanings.sent2: The ground's quakinesses during the earthquake were frightening.
meanings.sent3: The quakinesses of the wobbly table made it a terrible choice for the cake.
meanings.sent4: The quakinesses of her voice revealed her nervousness to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The quakinesses of the tree branches in the wind looked like dancing fingers.

meanings.definition: The tendency to shake or tremble.
meanings.sent1: His hands showed a noticeable quakinesses when he was anxious.
meanings.sent2: The quakinesses in her voice betrayed her fear.
meanings.sent3: The quakinesses of the shaky dog made him seem even cuter.
meanings.sent4: The quakinesses of the ground beneath us made me feel unsteady.
meanings.sent5: The quakinesses of the leaves in the breeze added a sense of movement to the scene.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being unsteady or unstable.
meanings.sent1: The quakinesses of the makeshift ladder made it unsafe to climb.
meanings.sent2: The quakinesses of the chair made it uncomfortable to sit on.
meanings.sent3: The quakinesses of the jello made it wobble in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The quakinesses of the economy caused uncertainty among investors.
meanings.sent5: The quakinesses of the boat on the rough sea made everyone seasick.
